author: Review1316USA

text: You knew that as soon as you were about to enter Dracula's chamber as the echo crescendos down your spine that he was waiting for and boy was he pissed!! No dialog no talk only the emergence of lighting sparks and paranormal activity as the whole chamber erupts violently as he's about to make his appearance and take your a$$ down!! There is no turning back as he's very confident, very pissed and you're about to find out why as the battle of death emerges..The music only highlights the situational desperation and the helpless situation you're about to find yourself in...Still the most haunting and sorrowful fight musical track in the franchise that shows everyone losses in the end.

text: It's not only an amazing, creepy music, but it was used well in the game. When you walk toward the final boss, torches light up, an finally you arrive to the evil himself, Dracula and instead of changing music immediately, it still plays during the fight. It gives a really dark atmosphere for the hole fight. It really feels like a real fight. And when he's going down, Simon's theme cues in like "IT'S TIME TO KICK ASS!"

text:
I love the Classic Castlevania series.
Did not like the new ones because I felt betrayed that a Belmont became Dracula after fighting Satan. (That is so a rip-off of Diablo to me. I contain the evil in me and yet I become it later.)
I still play all the Castlevania games to this day and will not stop.

author: baragokuotome

text: I will say this now, I love Illusionary Dance. It is a phenomenal arrangement, however, sometimes I feel it is a bit shallow when compared to this Dracula theme. Yes, Illusionary Dance is strong, vibrant and sinister but its showiness somewhat fails to differentiate itself from other boss themes (in general). The Dracula Battle theme here is oddly eerie and somber, and thus very fitting. This is the lord of darkness, and the end of your journey. This song and this battle transcends "catchy."
author: baragokuotome

text: @AmadeusKing Since I heard this theme first on his Castlevania-thon, I can't help but think about him while listening this this theme.

text:
"Souji" Taro Kudou, not Sotara Tojima. Two completely different people. Sorry, he is one of my favourite composers, so it bugs me. :-P Some misinformation spread across the internet regarding this mix up.

Anyways, I love this soundtrack. One of my top favourite Castlevania soundtracks.
